intro: Erica heterophylla, commonly known as the variable heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. Erica heterophylla is known for its adaptability to harsh environments and its ability to form dense thickets. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators.
